author: potuz

author: lightclient
content:
**ACDE Recap**
* Dencun fork dates confirmed:
  * Goerli - 17 Jan 2024 (epoch 231680) -> clients to release next week
  * Sepolia - 30 Jan 2024 (epoch 132608)
  * Holesky - 07 Feb 2024 (epoch 29696)
* Verkle seems like soft priority for next fork
  * most teams lean towards verkle, reth more interested in feature, nethermind/besu supportive of parallel push of small fork + verkle
  * if verkle is prio, next fork could be 12-24 months out
  * might couple some features with verkle, but should generally keep scope small
  * in the meantime, could possibly ship "tiny" EL fork to aid CL for, i.e. DAS fork would need to increase max blob limit
  * teams will continue to discuss internally and we'll come back ACD 179 to discuss more
*  Pectra -> Prague / Electra debate
  * EIP beauty contest, recommend reviewing the eth mag thread as we went over all the proposals: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/prague-electra-network-upgrade-meta-thread/16809
  * there were security/feasibility concerns voiced regarding 3074 AUTH+AUTHCALL, 6914 SETCODE, and the max code size increase.

author: suburbandad_
content: in a post-acd discussion, the besu team members present were aligned with nethermind on parallel push of small fork + verkle.  One of the considerations was that eip-6110 and eip-4444 could clear the path for the verkle migration in terms of storage.

author: potuz
content: It seemed that the general tone of the meeting was around parallel work on small fork + verkle. I'd like to slowly start commiting to which changes do we expect  on the CL side for the small fork. This is mostly for the CL teams: but I kinda suspect that Max EB is not doable on a small fork so it smells to me that either Max EB is the only change we work on to ship in a 12-18 month schedule with Verkle, or it gets pushed to at the very least 2 forks from now. Would like to hear from others what they think from the invasiveness of Max EB. I did look in detail because I'm anyway implementing it for Prysm for an ePBS project, and it's fairly invasive all across the code.

author: lightclient
content: What EL changes are required for max EB? I realize it is a high prio for CL teams but I skipped discussing it on this call bc the EIP says explicitly no EL changes are required

author: potuz
content: it requires 7002

author: potuz
content: which I think it's highest priority for this coming small fork

author: lightclient
content: isn’t 7002 just a nice to have for max EB? why doesn’t it work w/o it? seems like it is “required” bc if you have 7002 to you have to also support partial wx

author: g11tech
content: to change the limits may be

author: potuz
content: the UX of Max EB are pretty horrible without 7002, no one will adopt it

author: jgm
content:
6110 seems like an obvious mainly-CL change and would clear out a lot of technical debt.  7549 is an easy win.

I'd rather see a decision on the general direction of staking within the CL as per Vitalik's recent post before something like MaxEB was considered.

author: lightclient
content: 6110 primarily benefits CL but it is definitely a reasonably sized change to EL (modifying header)

author: jgm
content: Is the change to the header considered significant? Seems like it's a pretty minor one, from first glance.

author: lightclient
content: just a lot of testing required, rpc changes, etc - just saying it isn’t as simple as say MCOPY

author: potuz
content: 6110 I would rather hear from @mkalinin, but I'd risk to say that it can't happen at the same time of Verkle: the reason being that the forking itself is complicated.

author: potuz
content: 7549 I think it's a no-brainer and no contest that will be there in the coming fork, be it small or large. Will start implementing it right away

author: jgm
content: And I know that people are excited for 7002, but I'd love to see 6110 come in first and use the learnings from that to reshape 7002 if possible.  It may be that it can't be simplified, but for carrying out a single function it seems like it carries a lot of baggage (queue, variable costs, etc.)
